runs.comm: on his legs, Smith just nudged to leg
full and straight, Smith defends
very good line from the old master Pollock, not giving Vincent an inch. He leaves
ever so slightly fuller this time and Vincent drops it out to cover. They scamper for one
McCullum comes dancing down the pitch, as is his wont, nudging it out to cover
punched out to cover who is a little deep, allowing them through for a single
it's full but wide and punched aerially just to de Villiers' right who swoops down on it and throws down the stumps. Or tries, but misses
ooh well bowled, causing indecision from the batsman who nearly went for a cover drive before deciding to guide it down to third man
a beautiful delivery from Steyn, reminiscent of his Test bowling and McCullum is beaten by bounce and pace outside off
good grief. McCullum tries to hit this into Zimbabwe but completely misses, again beaten by pace but a touch of away swing too
straighter this time and it's nudged to leg
and another wild swing outside off to end a promising first over from Steyn
a huge wide from Pollock. He saw the batsman marching at him like a dissident army, banged it in short and as a result it was hugely short
bang. Too short, too straight and pulled in front of square for six! Top shot

shot! But caught! He absolutely nailed that on the front foot; a crunching, satisfying crack of the bat, but the ball found cover who didn't need to move a muscle, taking an easy catch in front of his nose
and he leaves alone comfortably outside off
punched to cover

nicely bowled, cramping him for room but he drops it out to cover and they scamper for a single. Danger in store though as the throw comes in; Vincent throws himself in to get over the line, the ball misses the stumps and they grab overthrows
shot! He's timed the underwear off that, pulling it in front of square for six
well bowled, Steyn. Full, on off stump and he can only push it rather meekly out to cover for a single
edged over the slips for four. Well, it was short and wide and he flung his bat at it, edging it just to Boucher's right and first slip can't get a fingertip on it either
nice comeback. Full, straight and defended
firmly defended to the bowler's right
oh well bowled, clever bowling - a slower ball on middle, though the batsman reads it and nudges it to leg
swing and a miss again. Vincent's head was pointed towards the sky there, roughly where he was hoping the ball might go...but he completely missed it
beaten outside off again, the away swing just taking the ball away from his swishing bat
fuller this time and he punches it to leg for a single
carved past Boucher through the vacant first slip for four. Rubbish ball from Pollock, mind; too short and wide and, with only a second slip in place, the shot was on
ah good comeback. Full, straight and defended. Pollock held that back a touch
a slower inswinger which he tries to pluck over midwicket for six but can't quite time it, and it drops like a mortar in the outfield
gone this time. Poor shot; he tried to smack this over long-on but got a leading edge to mid-off who swallowed a simple skier
awful ball. A leg-side bouncer and rightly wided
better start - bit of lift from Langeveldt, and it swings past the right-hander's arm-shouldering leave
Vincent drops this slower ball out to de Villiers at covers. Can he hit the stumps? Can he toffee. Missed them by a mile and they're safely home for a single
shorter but slower, it's defended
poor ball, far too straight and it wobbles off his pads down to fine leg for a single
fine ball this time though, angling into the batsman's pads before straightening off the pitch. Cautiously defended on the front foot
Taylor off the mark with a flick to leg
stroked out to Pollock at a deep mid-off. Trouble here! They go for a single and Pollock has all three stumps to aim at...and misses them by a mile
a belting shot. Short, wide and without moving his feet he flays this wide of the slips, over third man for six. Top, top shot. We like that
defended on the front foot
fine bowling from Morkel! That's the length on this pitch; it's got plenty of bounce and the taller bowlers are extracting it. It rises on Taylor who fends it straight to first slip
too full; too wide and left alone
poor bowling. Too wide and left alone
elegantly driven on the front foot out to Duminy, sweeping on the extra cover boundary
pushed out to deep cover for a cheekily stolen single
neatly guided past the lone slip for a single
carved over point with intent and he's timed it well, too, but Steyn sprints like a gazelle - he makes excellent ground indeed to save four
clunked aerially over cover. Beaten by a slower ball
guided down to Steyn at third man
well bowled, very well bowled indeed - full and straight, spearing into the right-hander's off stump who digs it out to the lurking de Villiers
beautiful stroke, but this format doesn't reward classy cover drives for no run...
dropped! No, it was wide of the diving slip - not far away there, Kallis

oh shot. "He's fetched that," says Cricinfo's chief finger-wagger, Jonathan Hungin, who ought to be working but claims his PC is broken. Super shot; just short of a length and it's pulled with meaty power through midwicket
pushed out to cover. Better, fuller ball this time
fantastic shot, a high-elbowed punch on the front foot...but again straight to cover
dropped to leg for a single
good start, nice and full and it's timed to leg
cautiously nudged through midwicket, only for one
sweeps around the corner, big shout for lbw but it's not out
flicked to deep square leg
punched back to the bowler
got him! A reverse sweep from Vincent to a straight, full ball which raps him on the toe and that's bang in front of middle. What an awful, hopeless shot that was
drifting down the leg side, he flicks it further for a single
oooh a big shout from the bowler and that looks dead to me. Bat pad, perhaps? It's not given
guided down to third man
wide and wided
carved off the outside edge wide of third man who jogs to his right to field
very well bowled. Short, quick and he extracts useful bounce there, beating a meek prod from the right-hander
punched to point, the non-striker gallops down the pitch and is miles out of his ground...but again the throw misses
full, straight and flicked to mid-on. No run on offer there, though partly due to Boucher absolutely roaring his thoughts on fielding to mid-on. You don't want to disagree with him really
smudged to mid-on again
guided out to point, just angling the face of the bat
nudged off his pads. Good flight
too full and he times this quite nicely through midwicket. But again, singles are simply not enough
pushed out to cover to end a tight over
full, but wide, pushed out to extra cover
down the leg side and it's off the pad for a single. In fact they grab two, as mid-off has to jog a fair distance to his right to field

oh dear. A meaningless shot to a poor, wide delivery outside off. He just patted it to point who scooped it up at ankle height to take an easy catch. A clueless stroke, really; rather like a coach might angle his bat to give the slips catching practice
on his legs it's nudged to square leg for a single
full and straight, punched to mid-on
a thick inside edge down to fine leg for a couple
Vettori goes for a huge front-foot slog and misses
rapped on the pads, the bowler roars an appeal - it does look straight, but perhaps was just outside the line
pumped back to the bowler
very well bowled. Full and straight and Vettori just can't get it away. He scampers down to attempt a single, but it was never on
and finally he's off strike with a clump to long-off
full toss, clumped out to deep extra cover
and he goes for an almighty heave-ho over midwicket but misses it
again short and wide, and again he tries to whack this over midwicket but gets a thick bottom edge, the ball squirting to cover
short, he tries to pull it but gets a top edge to Morkel at mid-on who back-peddles nicely to take a tumbling catch. New Zealand are finished
guided down to third man
ooh and he plays and misses outside off! New Zealand have utterly lost the plot. They just cannot get Pollock away
pushed aerially to cover, ending Pollock's excellent spell
timed out past point for a couple
that's neatly played. Outside the off stump, he plays it late with soft hands down to third man
full and straight, nudged to leg
breaking news: a four Styris skips down the pitch and clumps this through midwicket. Fine shot, and at last a boundary
a beautiful cover drive but he can't find the gap this time, and they can only steal a single
tries to sweep this past the short fine-leg but he makes good ground
too quick for the right hander who nervously nudges it to leg
oh, well caught Smith! Styris thumped this on the front foot, timing it very well but Smith, at mid-off, timed his leap to his left perfectly to clutch a fine catch above his head
ooh that was quick, rushing the right-hander back into his stumps and it's defended
well bowled - clever bowling by Steyn. From wider of the crease, angling into the right hander who tries to cut it but is beaten. Boucher takes to his left
nervously prodded back to the bowler
on off stump, it's firmly defended
too straight, turned off his pads and there's New Zealand's hundred
wided for height. Much too short
pushed to point and again a South African fielder misses the stumps! I make that four times they've failed to hit tonight...but look at the state New Zealand find themselves in
that's more like it! Tailend swishing here; a bouncer, he tries to hook it and manages to top-edge it over the keeper for four
beaten outside off. Nice and full, and a touch of outswing
shot! He's timed that brilliantly, lofting it miles over long-off. A classical lofted drive for six
he's gone for it again but hasn't quite timed it, and it drops on the outfield like a mortar
clumped on the front foot to mid-on
oh well bowled! Steyn's been fantastic tonight. A slower ball which completely foxes the batsman who tries to swing this into Zimbabwe, and is utterly beaten
wide, guided to third man. The throw is good, for once, but the batsman are home...
cluelessly nudged to leg. Another slower ball which confuses him rather a lot
he goes inside out, but Steyn "follows" him with a fast inswinger. The ball squirts out to third man
and again he steps outside leg to try and carve this over third man, but misses it completely
shot of the match so far. A fantastic, straight, Chris Cairns-like smash over the bowler's head. That's just the start to the over Mills needed
wide, wide...but not wided. Oh that's unfair, ump. And the umpire has a word with Langeveldt as if to say "watch it, son. You may not be so lucky next time"
again wide, again he swings and misses; again it's not wided
carved down to third man
and that is called a wide as it swings wider still of the off stump. Gillespie couldn't have reached that with the proverbial barge pole
pinged down to third man, but only for a single
mistimed to point
